instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Liquid damage, unable to read sensor error
threads.message:
Hi

Board was repaired 2 months ago ( liquid damaged a lot of place, ultrasonic cleaned and reballed SMC every thing was ok) but computer came back with fan noise and too slow. ASD report an error like bottom,

SMC: 0x0 (test #1) - SMC Critical Sensor Check Test
        - Checks if the SMC reports any errors on critical sensors.
[16:06:36]     ERROR -- 1 [The SMC reports an error on one or more critical sensors.] -- TEST FAILED

Temperature (Th1H) -- Fin Stack (test #1) - Sensor Reads Within Operating Range
        - Check to ensure that sensor reads within operating range.
[16:06:54]     ERROR -- 1 [Unable to read sensor] -- TEST FAILED

    Temperature (Th1H) -- Fin Stack (test #11) - Extended Sensor Flat Line Test
        - Checks that the Sensor changes value i.e. not stuck, with longer time allowance for change (5 mins).
[16:07:34]     ERROR - -13005 [The SMC can not read this sensor] -- TEST FAILED


Replaced SMC nothing changed.

Any idea for start to check?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Liquid damage, unable to read sensor error
threads.message: This sensor is on the IO board. Check cable/connector or replace IO board.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Liquid damage, unable to read sensor error
threads.message: Thanks for help duke but also replaced io board +flex cable but nothing changed. Only i m not sure connector is ok ( looking pins corrosion cleaned but but sure) have you Ever changed this connector? (i/o board connector)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Liquid damage, unable to read sensor error
threads.message: Problem solved after connector replace. thank you .
